text:
Byers is a city in Pratt County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 35 people lived there.
History.
Byers was created in 1914. It was named after Otto Phillip Byers.
The first post office in Byers was created in April 1915.
Geography.
Byers is at (37.787830, -98.867114). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 35 people, 15 households, and 9 families living in Byers.
2000 census.
The 2000 census says that there were 50 people, 20 households, and 18 families living in Byers.
